title: How to delete an old retweet from Twitter - Quora

response.answer_text: Before you start deleting your old Tweets, you need to know Twitter officially states that they only display your 3,200 most recent tweets on your timeline which means you can’t delete older tweets from your timeline. But there are 2 ways to delete all of your old tweets, retweets or replies, even you can filter them by date/keyword or username. The first way is the manual way and one by one process which takes to much effort to do that, but it is free. The Second way is automated and fast way but you need to pay. The First way is to delete all tweets directly on Twitter after you requested and downloaded your Twitter archive file. In all cases, firstly you need to request your Twitter Archive file from Twitter. Read the instructions below for how to download your Twitter archive file.Open up the Twitter Account pageClick on the More menu located on the left panel of your Twitter page and click on “Settings and privacy”Click on Your Twitter Data under Data and permissionsYou'll be required to enter your Twitter password to access to your Twitter data page Click on the “Request archive” button once you've successfully verified your password.When you request your archive, Twitter will prepare a ZIP file with the information most relevant to your account including all Tweets, images, videos you've shared (includes Retweeted ones too), and send you an email when it is ready.Check your e-mail. Click in the download link in the email Twitter sent you. This link will take you to your archive file's download page.Once you open up the Download or view data page, click on the button named Download dataNow you can delete your old tweets after clicking view data page.The Second way is automated and you can delete all old tweets at once. Even you can filter them by date keyword or languages. Once you open up the Download file instead of view data page click the download button on Twitter. ( This is your twitter archive file),Unzip and find the tweet.js file.Upload your tweet.js file. to Circleboom.Use below filters before deleting or delete all your tweet history at once.It’s done! your tweets would be deleted automatically. ! Don’t forget the “delete tweets” are always unrecoverable.

Twitter is designed in such a way that we end up retweeting a lot. So many times, we look at our Twitter profile and see it filled with all the tweets we never wish we retweeted. But, what if I told you not to feel too bad about it? Because you can delete retweets with as much as ease as you can publish it. With an efficient Twitter tool like tweet attack pro4, you can delete all your retweets. Here is how the tool makes deleting retweets really simple: 1, log in to the tool by authenticating your license code you received in your mail, and then add and verify your Twitter account 2, once logged in, go to Task Management menu to click Create new task, you will be taken to a new page to set up the delete retweet task. 3, on the next screen, add 3 these templates "AccountRunThread, Search, Unretweet" in order, and then complete the settings in each section. Next, click "Run checked task" to start running the task. And it will automatically delete all your retweets. In addition, you can also filter the retweets based on date, keywords, user, hashatag, and then select the retweets you want to delete. Final words, deleting retweets with the tool can save your a lot of time and extra effort. The user friendly interface helps you easily use it to delete retweets, tweets, unlike, like, follow, and more.
